u. S. Civil Service Commission
announces new examinations for
accounting technician, accounting
clerk, and welfare and pension
plan specialist.


Location of vacancies; ac-
counting technician and clerk
Federal Housing Administration
and other agencies in Washing
ton, DC. Starting salaries $4,2l5
and 81, 800. Applications must be
filed before Jan. 20 see announce
ment #34OB for details.


Welfare and pension plans
specialist positions are mainly
in the Dept. of Labor in Wash
ington, D. C. Sa1ries range from
$7,O3O-Se, $50. File applications
before Mar. 9 see announcement
#3l9B for details.


Civil service announcements
and applications are available
from Harold Passey, executive
secretary, RIM. 2Ol, Main Post
Office Bldg, 522 No. Central
Ave., Phoenix, or from the US.
Civil Service Commits sion,
Washington DC.

PHILADELPHIA The NAACP
obtained a pledge from the Trail
ways Bus Company, to employ
10 Negro drivers when hiring is
resumed in March.


The agreement wos reached
last week at a conference at
tended by representatives of the
local NAACP branch, headed by
president Cecil Moore and bus
company officials.

SALT LAKE CITY The Ma
tional Association for the Adj
vancement of Colored People an
nounced plans to picket Repub-
location Embarrassing dinner here
honoring Michigan Gov. George
Romney.


Albert B. Fritz, president of
the Salt Lake NAACP Chapter,
said the Jan. IL dinner would be
picketed because the Utah Re-
publican Party has not kept its
campaign promises for a public
accommodation bill.

Eric Evans, 48, 5l8 N. l8 St.
was charged with manslaughter in
the fatal shooting of Fred E.
Rose. SO, 1926 E. Jefferson.


Rose repeatedly threatened
Evans Saturday during an argu-
ment over gambling in front of
the Star Tavern, 1929 E. Wash
ington. Evans was charged with
voluntary manslaughter by Jus
tice of the Peace Charles F.
Coppock.

EVANS FACES


MANSLAUGHTER
CHARGE IN DEATH

which a great number of our y
Many helping hands are ex-
tended to these young offenders,
and the Boys Clubs of America
is always at the forefront in it's
efforts to furnish assistance.


Since it was founded in 1906,
this splendid organization has
guided thousands of boys away
from the disastrous path of
crime and toward responsible,
mature manhood. It's tireless en-
thusiasm and interest have often
succeeded in reaching boys who
have been unresponsive to other
groups.


The Boys Clubs of America
includes youngsters of every ma
tionality and religion working
and playing together under
proper supervision and in
healthful surroundings. The
wholesome outlets provided for
their youthful energies promote
desirable attitudes and behavior
which will benefit them through
out their lives.

NEW YORK Grady O-Cum-
mings III, chairman of the Ma
tional Civil Rights Party, says he
will enter New Hampshire s
March 10 primary in quest of
the Democratic presidential
nomination.


O'Cummings, "a, Negro, said
he wanted to focus attention on
the civil rights fight in this
country" He will go to New
Hampshire Jan. IL, he told a
news conference, to set up cam
paign headquarters.

Four men we're arrested Sat-
urday night at 1888 E. Wash
ington for gambling with dice
police reported.


Arrested we're: ]. D. Ander-
son, lo, 1916 E. Tonic; Terry
Anthony Smith, lo l4l4 E. Mad
ison; Clifton Wright, 26, 1921
E. Monroe; and Arthur Shivers,
Is, 1908 E. Buckeye Road.

Americas furnish ample evidence of the sinister
which number of people pursuing today
By J. Edgar Hoover, FBI Director

his itinerary with
publishers editors of The Arizona
He will visit Michigan and New Hampshire within the next
week.

Hogan Valley following his nationwide
